snippet: Mike Piazza hit more home runs as a catcher than any player in baseball, but suspicion about performance-enhancing drugs may have prevented him from being elected to the Hall of Fame.
abstract: Former New York Mets catcher Mike Piazza, in his first year on the Hall of Fame ballot, receives 57.8 percent of the vote, 98 votes shy of the required 75 percent for election; unlike Barry Bonds and Roger Clemens, who each collected less than 38 percent of the vote, Piazza has never been directly linked to performance-enhancing drugs.
lead_paragraph: Mike Piazza hit more home runs as a catcher than any player in baseball, but suspicion about performance-enhancing drugs may have prevented him from being elected to the Hall of Fame.

headline.seo: Mike Piazza Falls Short in Hall of Fame Voting
headline.main: Despite No Direct Tie to Steroids, Piazza Falls Short
headline.print_headline: Despite No Direct Tie to Steroids, Piazza Falls Short
